alert.note: Alert for Cameron Island; Kenedy Island; Willacy Island (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued June 21 at 3:28AM CDT until June 21 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous longshore and rip currents. * WHERE...Kenedy Island, Willacy Island and Cameron Island Counties. * WHEN...Through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...South to north longshore currents can move swimmers quickly up the beach, away from their entry points. Rip currents combined with the longshore currents can cause difficulty for swimmers to reach shore if caught out in deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of longshore and rip currents is most pronounced in breaks or weaknesses in the sandbar.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. The best thing to do is to remain in shallower water, with feet anchored into the sand. If caught in dangerous currents, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim toward the shoreline in the direction of breaking waves. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Cameron Island; Kenedy Island; Willacy Island
